intro: Pneumonanthe cruciata, commonly known as the cross-shaped lungwort, is a member of the Balsaminaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive cross-like pattern on the underside. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Its unique leaf markings and striking floral display make it a notable species in botanical gardens and woodland habitats.
